climbs.name: AKA Coffee Burp and Coffee Fart

content.description:
The routes can be seen from Highway 16 up in a prominent cleft on the Northside of Copper Mountain. The large ice sheet on the right side of the cleft is refereed to as Coffee burp. The route can be affected by the amount of snow on it. There is also another route further up the gulley that that was also climbed by Elizebeth and Peter that has more recently been named Coffee Fart a little longer and a little easier. This too can become covered in snow later in the season.

Drive off main highway and before driving u p the hill on the Copper FSR. Park in open area and hike up and past the gravel pit making your way up to the prominent cleft on the mountain.Â 
Ice screws

Short route that forms up on the left side of Candy box.

Access is the same for Copper mountain rock climbs up North end of face. Hike or drive up power line access road on North side. Once at the top of hill make your way left toward a small bluff with a thread of ice on it.
Ice screws

Copper Mountain has a number of ice routes that have been developed over the years. A few can be seen from town the most notable Eternal Urinal a large formation that faces Terrace that forms up in the deepest of cold snaps. The yellow ice drips down from the top of the rock face forming a thin sheet of ice with a overhanging curtain bellow. The route has been Top roped by locals in the 90's but has yet to see a ground up ascent due to the fragile nature of the ice.
